text: Bhāskara was an Indian philosopher and proponent of the Bhedabheda school of Vedanta philosophy. He wrote commentaries on the Brahma Sutras, and contested Shankara's doctrine of māyā.Swami Prabhavananda (1962/1979), Spiritual Heritage of India (see article), Vedanta Press, , p. 299. ==References== == External links == * The Bhāskara School of Philosophy, by Surendranath Dasgupta From: A History of Indian Philosophy Volume 3 *Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy: Bhedabheda Category:Vedanta Category:Indian male philosophers
